alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 1:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong and Gusty Winds from Tonight through Monday Afternoon... South to southwest winds will begin to increase along the Rocky Mountain Front early this evening ahead of an eastward advancing Pacific front, which will cross the area between 9 PM MDT this evening and 3 AM MDT Monday. Southwest winds in wake of the passing front will then become sustained at between 35 to 45 mph through early Monday afternoon, with wind gusts approaching 65 mph. Showers along the eastward advancing front could produce higher, localized wind gusts, but these higher wind gusts are expected to be isolated in nature. Travelers are urged to exercise caution if traveling through Monday afternoon, especially those in high-profile vehicles. Be prepared for strong cross winds.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
